_description: John Audelay, ‘De matrimonio mulierum’ — seven 5-line stanzas (ababc) with ‘All day thou seest’ refrain and burden: ‘Avyse youe wemen wom ye trust / & beware of had i wys’

BodDou302.First Lines:
Hit is ful heue chastiteWith mone maydyns now
                    oday…
BodDou302.Last Lines:
…& lese worchip honowre & graceAl day þou
                    seest
BodDou302.Editions:
Chambers,  Edmund Kerchever,  and  Frank Sidgwick.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols by John Audelay, II.” 
             Modern Language Review
         6 (1911): 68-84: 78-9.
Whiting,  Ella Keats,
                        ed.  
             John Audelay: The Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 184 (1931); repr. 1988: 208-9.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.

            1977: 276; 1977, 244-5.
